meanings.definition: To make an object the focus of excessive or irrational devotion or reverence.
meanings.sent1: She fetishised her lucky charm, believing it brought her good luck.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity's fans fetishised his autograph, considering it a prized possession.
meanings.sent3: He fetishised his favorite pen, always carrying it around like a precious gem.
meanings.sent4: Her obsession with cleanliness fetishised her vacuum cleaner, treating it like a sacred tool.
meanings.sent5: The child fetishised their teddy bear, refusing to sleep without it by their side.

meanings.definition: To treat something with excessive or irrational attention or reverence.
meanings.sent1: The chef fetishised the secret recipe, guarding it closely from others.
meanings.sent2: She fetishised her morning routine, following it religiously every day.
meanings.sent3: He fetishised his car, washing it multiple times a day to keep it spotless.
meanings.sent4: The artist fetishised their paintbrush, believing it held the key to their creativity.
meanings.sent5: The student fetishised their textbook, never letting anyone else borrow it.
